1.descricao:
Flying

Whenever you draw a card, Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

{T}: Draw a card.

2.descricao: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
2.texto: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.

regras.texto: If you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend's ability triggers  and goes on the stack on top of it. The ability will resolve before the  spell does.

3.descricao: Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
3.texto: When asked how much power is required, Izzet mages always answer "more."

regras.texto: Two Goblin Electromancers will make instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {2} less to cast, and so on.
Goblin Electromancer can't reduce the colored mana requirement of an instant or sorcery spell.

If there are additional costs to cast a spell, such as a kicker cost or a cost imposed by another effect (such as the one imposed by Thalia, Guardian of Thraben's ability), apply those increases before applying cost reductions.
Goblin Electromancer can reduce alternative costs such as overload costs.

4.descricao:
({U/R} can be paid with either {U} or {R}.)

{2}{U}: Copy target instant spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.

{2}{R}: Copy target sorcery spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.

5.descricao:
{T}: Gelectrode deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may untap Gelectrode.
5.texto:
"Diametrically opposing energies in self-sealed plasmodermic bubbles make great pets!"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

6.descricao:
Flying

Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Wee Dragonauts gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
6.texto:
"The blazekite is a simple concept, really—just a vehicular application of dragscoop ionics and electropropulsion magnetronics."
—Juzba, Izzet tinker

7.descricao: When Steamcore Weird enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Steamcore Weird, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
7.texto: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.

8.descricao:
Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.

{U/R}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn.

Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.

Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.

regras.texto: If you cast a spell that's both of the listed colors, both abilities will trigger. You'll remove a total of two -1/-1 counters from the Hatchling.
If there are no -1/-1 counters on it when the triggered ability resolves, the ability does nothing. There is no penalty for not being able to remove a counter.

9.descricao: When Ogre Savant enters the battlefield, if {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant, return target creature to its owner's hand.

regras.texto: If {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant and no other creatures are on the battlefield, the Ogre will have to return itself.
The ability is not optional.

10.descricao: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.
10.texto: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.

regras.texto: If the card you look at isn't an instant or sorcery card, it remains on top of your library. You don't reveal it.
You may pay additional costs, such as kicker costs, of the instant or sorcery card.
If the card has any mandatory additional costs, as Kuldotha Rebirth does, you must pay them in order to cast the spell.
If the card has an X in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.

11.descricao: When Izzet Chronarch enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
11.texto: He ensures not only whether but also when and where the lightning strikes twice.

12.descricao:
({U/R} can be paid with either {U} or {R}.)

Flying

Each instant and sorcery spell you cast has replicate. The replicate cost is equal to its mana cost. (When you cast it, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

regras.texto: If you cast a spell that already has replicate while you have this creature on the battlefield, the spell will have two replicate abilities
If you cast an instant or sorcery spell that has {X} in its mana cost, the value of X in the spell's replicate cost will be the same as the value of X you chose for its mana cost.

13.descricao: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
13.texto: The mizzium-sphere array drove her mind deep into the thought field, where only the rarest motes of genius may be plucked.

regras.texto: This is all one effect. You draw 3 and return 2 cards all in one resolution. Nothing may happen between the two. If something triggers on drawing cards, it will go on the stack after Brainstorm finishes resolving.

14.descricao: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

regras.texto: The payment is optional.

15.descricao: Magma Spray deals 2 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
15.texto:
"Jund is a wounded world. Beware its searing blood spilling out onto the surface."
—Rakka Mar

regras.texto: The second sentence will exile the targeted creature if it would be put into a graveyard this turn for any reason, not just due to lethal damage. It applies to the targeted creature even if Magma Spray deals no damage to it (due to a prevention effect) or Magma Spray deals damage to a different creature (due to a redirection effect).

The second sentence will exile the target creature if it would die this turn for any reason, not just due to lethal damage. It applies to the target creature even if Magma Spray deals no damage to it (due to a prevention effect) or Magma Spray deals damage to a different creature (due to a redirection effect).

16.descricao:
Imprint — When Isochron Scepter enters the battlefield, you may exile an instant card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand.

{2}, {T}: You may copy the exiled card. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

regras.texto: If the imprinted card leaves the Exile zone while the ability to make a copy is on the stack, then no copy will be made.
If this card leaves the battlefield while the ability to make a copy is on the stack, the ability will still make a copy using the last-known-information rule.
Isochron Scepter's second ability creates a copy of the imprinted card in the Exile zone (that's where the imprinted instant card is), then allows you to cast it without paying its mana cost.

You cast the copy while this ability is resolving, and still on the stack. Normally, you're not allowed to cast spells or activate abilities at this time. Isochron Scepter's ability provides an exception.
You don't pay the spell's mana cost. If the spell has X in its mana cost, X is 0. You do pay any additional costs for that spell. You can't use any alternative costs.

If the copied card is a split card, you may choose to cast either side of the split card, but not both. The split cards Fire/Ice, Illusion/Reality, Night/Day, Stand/Deliver, and Wax/Wane all have at least one side with converted mana cost 2 or less.)
You can't cast the copy if an effect prevents you from casting instants or from casting that particular instant.
You can't cast the copy unless all of its targets can be chosen.
If you don't want to cast the copy, you can choose not to; the copy ceases to exist the next time state-based actions are checked.
The creation of the copy and then the casting of the copy are both optional.

17.texto: The Izzet signet is redesigned often, each time becoming closer to a vanity portrait of Niv-Mizzet.

18.descricao: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller draws a card.
18.texto: On Bant, a sigil is both a prize of honor and a bond of duty. The one who bears it may be called to fulfill that charge at any moment.

regras.texto: The player who draws a card is the player who controls the creature when Call to Heel resolves. This may not be the player whose hand the creature is put into.
If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target before Call to Heel resolves, Call to Heel is countered. No one draws a card.

19.descricao:
Replicate {1}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)

Draw a card.
19.texto: "But then . . . oh, but . . . which means . . . which would lead to . . . exactly!"

20.descricao:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

Pyromatics deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

21.descricao: Choose one — Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}; or Izzet Charm deals 2 damage to target creature; or draw two cards, then discard two cards.

22.descricao: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
22.texto: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

regras.texto: This card won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

23.descricao:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)

Put a 3/3 blue Weird creature token with defender and flying onto the battlefield. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
23.texto: The clouds grew thick, and then they grew teeth.

24.descricao:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

Return target creature to its owner's hand.

25.descricao: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
25.texto:
"This abomination never belonged in our world. I'm merely setting it free."
—Dierk, geistmage

regras.texto: The card does not go to the graveyard before being exiled.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled.

26.descricao:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target player. You draw a card."
26.texto: The dwarves call their quicksilver techniques "improvisational weaponsmithing."

27.descricao: Prophetic Bolt deals 4 damage to target creature or player. Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

28.descricao: Counter target creature spell. Draw cards equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

29.descricao: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may put a charge counter on Sphinx-Bone Wand. If you do, Sphinx-Bone Wand deals damage equal to the number of charge counters on it to target creature or player.
29.texto: Its host's final curse lies captured within.

regras.texto: If you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Sphinx-Bone Wand's ability  triggers and goes on the stack on top of it. The ability will resolve  before the spell does.
If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time  the ability resolves, the ability is countered. You won't put a charge  counter on Sphinx-Bone Wand and it won't deal damage.
If Sphinx-Bone Wand leaves the battlefield before its ability  resolves, you won't be able to put a charge counter on it. As a result,  it won't deal damage.

30.descricao:
Street Spasm deals X damage to target creature without flying you don't control.

Overload {X}{X}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

regras.texto: If you don't pay the overload cost of a spell, that spell will have a single target. If you pay the overload cost, the spell won't have any targets.
Because a spell with overload doesn't target when its overload cost is paid, it may affect permanents with hexproof or with protection from the appropriate color.
Note that if the spell with overload is dealing damage, protection from that spell's color will still prevent that damage.
Overload doesn't change when you can cast the spell.
Casting a spell with overload doesn't change that spell's mana cost. You just pay the overload cost instead.
Effects that cause you to pay more or less for a spell will cause you to pay that much more or less while casting it for its overload cost, too.
If you are instructed to cast a spell with overload “without paying its mana cost,” you can't choose to pay its overload cost instead.

31.descricao: Choose one — Draw X cards; or Invoke the Firemind deals X damage to target creature or player.
31.texto: To those in tune with the Firemind, there is no difference between knowledge and flame.

regras.texto: As you cast Invoke the Firemind, first you choose the mode (draw cards or deal damage), then you choose the value of X. You then choose a target, but only if you chose the second mode.

32a.descricao: Fire deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.

32b.descricao:
Tap target permanent.

Draw a card.

33.descricao:
Forgotten Cave enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

34.descricao:
Izzet Boilerworks enters the battlefield tapped.

When Izzet Boilerworks enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

{T}: Add {U}{R} to your mana pool.

regras.texto: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

35.descricao:
Lonely Sandbar enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

36.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{2}{U}{R}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library. Until your next turn, you may cast that card if it's an instant or sorcery.
36.texto: Niv-Mizzet's genius and vanity reverberate throughout the mirrored halls of Nivix.

regras.texto: "Until your next turn" means the effect wears off as soon as your next turn starts, even before you untap. It's basically the same as "until the end of the turn of the player who immediately precedes you."

The card is cast using all normal rules and restrictions for casting spells. Casting it means you'll have to pay its mana cost, and it will go to the graveyard after it resolves or is countered. The only thing that's different is you're casting it from the Exile zone.
If you don't cast the card, it stays exiled.

45.descricao:
Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.

{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.

Sacrifice a Swamp and a Forest: Return Jarad from your graveyard to your hand.

regras.texto: Jarad's first ability applies only when Jarad is on the battlefield.
The life loss is based on the power of the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

To activate Jarad's last ability, you must sacrifice two lands. It doesn't matter what other land types the two lands have, as long as one is a Swamp and one is a Forest. Even if one of the lands you sacrifice is both a Swamp and a Forest, you have to sacrifice another land that is a Swamp or a Forest.
You can sacrifice any land with the land type Swamp or Forest, not just ones named Swamp or Forest. For example, you could sacrifice two Overgrown Tombs.

46.descricao: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
46.texto:
"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra

47.descricao: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
47.texto: Cast out of the Conclave generations ago, these elves found a home in the corrupted districts of the Golgari.

48.descricao:
When Golgari Thug dies, put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.

Dredge 4 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly four cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

regras.texto: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

49.descricao: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
49.texto: Devouring books is only the beginning. The librarian's next.

50.descricao: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
50.texto:
"They may show up with the wrong thigh bone or mandible, but they always show up."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

51.descricao: Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
51.texto: The only thing it likes more than discovering a pit of bones is adding to it.

regras.texto: The ability that defines Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness works in   all zones, not just the battlefield. If Boneyard Wurm is in your graveyard, it will count itself.

52.descricao:
{1}{B}{G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains intimidate until end of turn.

{2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

regras.texto: Use the sacrificed creature's toughness when it was last on the battlefield to determine the value of X.

53.descricao: Pay 2 life: Putrid Leech gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
53.texto: It reacted to Naya's overabundant food supply by growing additional mouths.

54.descricao:
Flying

Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.

Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

regras.texto: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
Notably, Stinkweed Imp's ability isn't deathtouch. It's a triggered ability that triggers only on combat damage.

55.descricao: When Eternal Witness enters the battlefield, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
55.texto: She remembers every word spoken, from the hero's oath to the baby's cry.

56.descricao:
Haste

Scavenge {3}{B}{G} ({3}{B}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

regras.texto: Exiling the creature card with scavenge is part of the cost of activating the scavenge ability. Once the ability is activated and the cost is paid, it's too late to stop the ability from being activated by trying to remove the creature card from the graveyard.

57.descricao:
Sacrifice Shambling Shell: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

58.descricao:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

Sacrifice Brain Weevil: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

regras.texto: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

59.descricao: Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

regras.texto: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

60.descricao:
Golgari Grave-Troll enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each creature card in your graveyard.

{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Golgari Grave-Troll: Regenerate Golgari Grave-Troll.

Dredge 6 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly six cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

regras.texto: If an effect puts Golgari Grave-Troll onto the battlefield from your graveyard, Golgari Grave-Troll counts itself as one of the cards in your graveyard and gets a counter accordingly.
Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

61.descricao:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

When Stingerfling Spider enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with flying.
61.texto: The juiciest prey is that which grows lazy, thinking itself beyond the reach of danger.

regras.texto: You choose the target creature with flying when the ability goes on the stack. When it resolves, you choose whether or not to destroy the creature.

62.descricao: Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
62.texto: "Victory in the pits is almost as rewarding as the methods I use to achieve it."

regras.texto: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

63.descricao: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life.
63.texto: Like corpse-worms through a carapace, rotwurms slide through the hollowed bones of the undercity.

64.descricao:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)

Trample

At the beginning of your end step, return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.

regras.texto: When this ability resolves, it returns all creature cards currently in your graveyard that were put there directly from the battlefield sometime during the turn. This includes cards that were put into your graveyard before Gleancrawler entered the battlefield.

65.descricao:
Trample

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
65.texto: It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.

regras.texto: If you have no other creatures to sacrifice, you'll have to sacrifice Doomgape itself. You'll gain life equal to its toughness.

66.texto: Depending on your point of view, the seal represents a proud guardian of the natural cycle or one who has sold her soul to darkness for eternal life.

67.descricao: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
67.texto: Mercadians not wealthy enough to buy a tomb are thrown into a bog called "the Ghoul's Larder."

68.descricao:
Enchant creature

When a creature dies, destroy enchanted creature.
68.texto: The demon's yoke is part leash, part noose.

69.descricao:
Return up to three target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.

Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

regras.texto: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

70.descricao: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
70.texto: The Golgari don't bury their dead. They plant them.

71.descricao: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.
71.texto:
"All matter, animate or not, rots when exposed to time. We merely speed up the process."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

regras.texto: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an artifact, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

72.descricao: Choose one — Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield; or destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature and it can't be regenerated.
72.texto:
"The living cannot understand the benefits of death."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

73.descricao:
Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

regras.texto: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

74.descricao: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
74.texto: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.

regras.texto: The +1/+1 counter from this ability is in addition to any other counters the creature enters the battlefield with.

75.descricao: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.
75.texto:
"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald

regras.texto: Count the number of creature cards in your graveyard when Grim Flowering resolves.

76.descricao:
You may cast Twilight's Call any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it.

Each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

regras.texto: All the creature cards enter the battlefield simultaneously.

For purposes of ordering any continuous effects of the creatures, the current player (not the controller of this spell) decides the ordering regardless of which player is putting the creatures onto the battlefield.

77a.descricao: All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

regras.texto: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

77b.descricao: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

78.descricao:
Barren Moor enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

79.descricao:
Dakmor Salvage enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

regras.texto: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

80.descricao:
Golgari Rot Farm enters the battlefield tapped.

When Golgari Rot Farm enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

{T}: Add {B}{G} to your mana pool.

regras.texto: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

81.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{3}{B}{G}: Until end of turn, Svogthos, the Restless Tomb becomes a black and green Plant Zombie creature with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard." It's still a land.

regras.texto: While animated, Svogthos's power and toughness changes each time a creature card enters or leaves its controller's graveyard.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

82.descricao:
Tranquil Thicket enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

Cycling {G} ({G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
